svg.title: Lissajous_1_1_0.svg
svg.desc:
Lissajous-curves
x(t) = sin(pi * 1 * 2 * t) y(t) = sin(pi * 1 * (2 * t - 0))
f1/f2 = 1/1 phi = 0
plotted with several adapted cubic bezier-curves The plotcurves were calculated by some fancy code. The bezier-curve controlpoints are placed on tangents of the function-curve. They are furthermore positioned in a way to minimize the average quadratic distance between the bezier-curve and the function. This gives an accuracy, so that the deviation is in no point greater than 0.00001.
about: http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Image:Lissajous_1_1_0.svg source: http://commons.wikimedia.org/ rights: GNU Free Documentation license, Creative Commons Attribution ShareAlike license
